struct __pyx_opt_args_9histogram__spatial {

 36:      int npatterns=59, int overlapX=2, int overlapY=2):


 37: 	"""


 38: 	> Implementation of Ahonen's Enhanced Spatial Histogram, with overlaps.


 39: 	> The window size couldn't be fixed. Example, if there are 2 noses


 40: 	  pictures of the same dog, the first 800x800 and the second 400x400,


 41: 	  then the spatial information will not match.


 42: 	> More or less realistic assumption; the noses pictures will keep ratio.


 43: 	> x and y will mean for vertical and horizontal directions respectively,


 44: 	  (x->rows direction and y->columns direction)


 45: 	> nx and ny stands for the number of divisions in vertical and horizontal


 46: 	  axis, respectively.


 47: 	"""


 48: 


 49: 	cdef:


 50: 		int height = src.shape[0]


  __pyx_v_height = (__pyx_v_src.shape[0]);

 51: 		int width = src.shape[1]


  __pyx_v_width = (__pyx_v_src.shape[1]);

 52: 


 53: 		#widows size: (wsx,wsy)


 54: 		int wsx = (height+(nx-1)*overlapX)/nx


  __pyx_v_wsx = ((__pyx_v_height + ((__pyx_v_nx - 1) * __pyx_v_overlapX)) / __pyx_v_nx);

 55: 		int wsy = (width+(ny-1)*overlapY)/ny


  __pyx_v_wsy = ((__pyx_v_width + ((__pyx_v_ny - 1) * __pyx_v_overlapY)) / __pyx_v_ny);

 56: 


 57: 		#remainders=(xrem,yrem), ie, number of pixels that


 58: 		#can't be covered with such windows sizes


 59: 		int xrem = height-nx*wsx+(nx-1)*overlapX


  __pyx_v_xrem = ((__pyx_v_height - (__pyx_v_nx * __pyx_v_wsx)) + ((__pyx_v_nx - 1) * __pyx_v_overlapX));

 60: 		int yrem = width-ny*wsy+(ny-1)*overlapY


  __pyx_v_yrem = ((__pyx_v_width - (__pyx_v_ny * __pyx_v_wsy)) + ((__pyx_v_ny - 1) * __pyx_v_overlapY));

 61: 	"""


 62: 	> Each image subdivision will be named region. there are in


 63: 	  total nx*ny regions.


 64: 	> Each region has two index Rxy=R[x,y].


 65: 	> All regions R[0:rx0,:] and R[rx1:,:] will have a windows


 66: 	  size with one more pixel on x direction.


 67: 	> All regions R[:,0:ry0] and R[:,ry1:] will have a windows


 68: 	  size with one more pixel on y direction.


 69: 	"""


 70: 	cdef int rx0, rx1, ry0, ry1


 71: 


 72: 	if xrem%2==0:


  __pyx_t_1 = (((__pyx_v_xrem % 2) == 0) != 0);
  if (__pyx_t_1) {

 73: 		rx0 = xrem/2-1


    __pyx_v_rx0 = ((__pyx_v_xrem / 2) - 1);

 74: 		rx1 = nx-xrem/2


    __pyx_v_rx1 = (__pyx_v_nx - (__pyx_v_xrem / 2));
    goto __pyx_L3;
  }
  /*else*/ {

 75: 	else:


 76: 		rx0 = xrem/2


    __pyx_v_rx0 = (__pyx_v_xrem / 2);

 77: 		rx1 = nx-xrem/2


    __pyx_v_rx1 = (__pyx_v_nx - (__pyx_v_xrem / 2));
  }
  __pyx_L3:;

 78: 	if yrem%2==0:

 79: 		ry0 = yrem/2-1

 80: 		ry1 = ny-yrem/2

  }
  /*else*/ {

 81: 	else:


 82: 		ry0 = yrem/2

 87: 		#LBP histograms of each region.
